message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AR, cs.MM

The paper discusses the design of novel massive MIMO architectures for millimeter wave (mmWave) systems, which involves signal processing and communication technologies. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory). Additionally, the paper also discusses the energy efficiency and scalability of the proposed architectures, which falls under the categories of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). The use of reflect-array (RA) and transmit-array (TA) antennas involves the design of hardware components, which falls under the category of cs.AR (Hardware Architecture). Finally, the paper also discusses the sparsity of mmWave channels, which is a topic in the field of compressed sensing and falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia).
